title: The Ice After the Fire: Why Caracas Was Just the Warm-Up for Nuuk
content:
By mid-morning on Saturday, the language being used about Caracas had already started to harden into something dangerous: &lsquo;capture&rsquo;, &lsquo;removal&rsquo;, &lsquo;operation&rsquo;. On Truth Social, President Donald Trump claimed that US forces had taken Nicolás Maduro and his wife into custody and flown them out of Venezuela. In the vacuum that followed, Venezuela&rsquo;s own vice-president admitted she did not know where Maduro was, or even whether he was still alive.
In London, …

title: Friend or Foe?
content:
The crisis that would eventually cost Dr E five months of her career did not begin with a missed diagnosis or a clinical disaster. It began with a deadline every working parent in Britain understands with familiar dread: the nursery pickup.
The time was 4.30pm on Wednesday 17th July 2024. Dr E, a salaried GP at a busy medical centre, was staring at her appointment screen and the clock. She was in the grip of a specific panic. She had three young children, her husband was working away and she had …

title: About
content:
Matt Kneale is an emergency medicine clinical fellow and Co-chair of the Doctors&rsquo; Association UK (DAUK), a grassroots organisation representing and defending doctors across the United Kingdom. He has been a passionate advocate for doctors&rsquo; rights and patient safety since joining DAUK in March 2020.
Advocacy &amp; Leadership As Co-chair, Matt works to address critical issues facing the NHS workforce, including chronic understaffing, doctor burnout, and the erosion of professional …
